text: Hello friends, I am Faizan - content manager at Breeze. A b2b SaaS product for Magento Hosting. Similar to what Kinsta offer for WordPress, we do for Magento. I manage everything content - email writing, Knowledgebase, inhouse documentation, chatbots, social media, cold outreach, blogs, copywriting, event creatives, video scripts etc. So, yes, I have generalized skill set in b2b tech space.  Also trying to find freelance projects. See you everyone. :slightly_smiling_face:

text:
Hello new friends! I'm Emily — Director of Content Marketing at B2B cybersecurity company, ZeroFox. I started in cybersecurity marketing nearly 10 years ago and never looked back! I love the community — it's all about trust, purpose, and transparency, with a hint of snark.

At ZeroFox, I'm responsible for the organization's overall content strategy and brand tone. I'm only three weeks into this role, but I'm loving it, working across the entire organization with like-minded people who understand the unique audience and their style.

Looking forward to getting to know other content marketers and learning from you all!

text:
Hello, amazing writers and learners. 

I'm Charles Chimezirim—a fintech content marketer from Nigeria. By fintech, I mean I write finance and tech (blockchain, tech products, innovation, etc.)-related articles for B2B and B2C audiences.

I'm happy to join this great community, and can't wait to learn and share my ideas in the content marketing space.

I also look forward to connecting with other writers and marketers in my niche.

Cheers to the writers' life!

text:
Hey y'all! :wave: Raven here from Atlanta, GA. I'm a Content Strategist with a soft spot for Social Media.  (My bread and butter is taking one piece of content and repurposing it 1M different ways for the different audiences.)

I'm currently contemplating my next career move in the marketing world — To go freelance FT or find another Content / Social Media role at a company. I'm ready to learn from yall and give my 2 cents where I can.

text:
Hello all! I'm Laura, currently based in Boise, ID (but hankering to get back to Tokyo). :japan: I'm a novel-editor-turned-content-strategist.

I take sprawling, strategy-less company blogs and turn them into lead-generating engines. To that end, I'm developing an online course for in-house novice content managers under the name "The Content Mechanic." :hammer_and_wrench: It's still very much a WIP.

I work primarily in the small business / finance vertical, but am always interested in companies furthering economic equity. I'm here to sharpen my content marketing chops and learn from my betters!

text:
Hi, my name is Rahul. I'm from India. I work at a B2B SaaS startup named Corizance as a marketer. I have past internship experience in content (copywriting and editing), but I'm still quite raw when it comes to overall marketing/content skills. I'm trying to upskill myself and learn from established marketers. 

Thanks for admitting me into this community, I hope to learn from you!

text:
Hey Laura :wave::skin-tone-3: Nice to meet you! Super cool about the course. I'm curious, is editorial part of the picture? Both from a guidelines/principles perspective but also on the editor training and development side. 

I've started putting together a training program for the editors on my team, so I have content training on the brain haha.

text: Hello all! Great to be here! I found this place through LinkedIn, and it seems like an amazing marketing community. A bit about me - I’m a deaf entrepreneur, freelance content writer turned agency owner. My agency focuses on SEO and content marketing for SaaS companies. I hope to meet people here and exchange insights when possible.
